Show Me Case Studies

Why Viral Campaigns?

Collect a lot of email addresses

Viral campaigns are designed to get shared a lot. If you want to collect a lot of email addresser, you are at the right place.

Basically free

You only pay for this software. No PPC fee, no CPM

Reach the masses

Get email addresses from people you would not reach via ads

Care Study: Harry's Razors

Harry’s shavers launched their product and gathered 100,000 email addresses in the process. Tim Ferriss Blog has a great write-up on how they did it.

Software used: prelaunchr, programmed internally.

Tweetlead.io

Tweetlead.io is a free SaaS to put up Twitter cards. This technology enables marketers to ask people to opt-in inside tweets.

This free tool is part of the sales funnel for Upviral, which they use as their backend. They claim to have collected 16,000 emails in 4 days.

Google Web Fonts and
Font Awesome Icons

Manuel Dingemann is a Mac productivity expert from Hamburg, Germany. He gives out his free info product through referrals. Campaign status: still in launch.

Software used: Viralget. Check out Dingemann’s Course (German)) for a demo.

Pricing

Hosted Version

It works like this: you tell us what you want to pay per collected email address. We'll let you know when we can serve you.

Highest offers get served first.

Show Me The Form

Server Licence

We ship you the full code on a newly installed digital ocean server. You can go ahead and customize however you like. Permitted are campaigns for yourself, not for clients.

Price: 1000 EUR (Excl. VAT).

Request Licence

Questions and Answers

What makes Viralget different

Other viral campaign tools are not customizable. Viralget brings you the complete power over templates.

Emails are only branded by you. Nothing interferes with your brand.

Why is it so expensive?

The server licence is more expensive than a monthly installed SaaS - but it's only a one-time fee.

What software platform do you use?

Laravel 5, digital ocean servers and postmark

Why is it so cheap?

We offer a fair deal. The software is not complex, but much more than a normal person could develop by himself.

Questions? Email us!
